TypeSignature.Value: public delegate int PropSheetPageProc(IntPtr hwnd, int uMsg, IntPtr lParam);
.class public auto ansi sealed PropSheetPageProc extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Function PropSheetPageProc(hwnd As IntPtr, uMsg As Integer, lParam As IntPtr) As Integer
public delegate int PropSheetPageProc(IntPtr hwnd, int uMsg, IntPtr lParam);
type PropSheetPageProc = delegate of nativeint * int * nativeint -> int

Docs.param: Reserved; must be null (Nothing in Visual Basic).
An action flag specifying that a page or a dialog box for a page is being created or a page is being destroyed.
A pointer to a structure defining the page being created or destroyed.
Docs.summary: Specifies a callback function that a property sheet calls when a page is created and when the page is about to be destroyed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about programming with the PropSheetPageProc delegate and the Microsoft Management Console (MMC), see the [MMC Programmer's Guide](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/windows/desktop/mmc/mmc-programmer-s-guide-overview).
